segments.text: ( Laugh ) All right . You caught me in the act . I finally worked up the nerve to ask Diana out . I was just writing a note to put on her desk .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You mean you're going to ask her out in a note ? You big chicken !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I admit it . I'm a wuss . I just can't do it in person .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But , you work with her everyday .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's different . When I'm working , I'm in a different frame of mind . But , when I even think about asking her out , I get tongue-tied . At least in a note , I can get the words out without turning beet red .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You've dated a lot . What's so different about Diana ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , for one thing , she's gorgeous . She's so upbeat and sweet . Who doesn't like her ? Oh , I don't know . All I do know is that I think we have great chemistry together . But , what if I'm wrong . Maybe she's just been nice to me out of courtesy and doesn't think of me that way . Oh ... forget it . This was a bad idea .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , I guess you don't want this note , then .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I was looking for you to deliver this note from Diana . She wants to know if you want to go to the office party with her tomorrow night .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You're kidding ! I can't believe you've been standing this entire time and didn't say anything .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Sorry . What can I say ? Now , do you want the note or what ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Have a great time tomorrow night .
segments.speaker: S1
